decks.notes: The deck focuses on utilizing powerful control spells and creature removal to disrupt the opponent's game plan while establishing a solid board presence with versatile creatures like Baleful Strix and Tasiur, the Golden Fang. It also includes a variety of counterspells and card draw options to help maintain card advantage and control the pace of the game. The commander, Glarb, Calamity's Augur, provides a unique synergy with the deck by allowing for additional card advantage and graveyard manipulation. The deck aims to outvalue opponents by efficiently handling threats and steadily building towards a win condition, whether through creature beats or a combo finish.

The deck focuses on aggressive play using Kellan, the Fae-Blooded as the commander. It utilizes efficient creatures and equipment to deal with threats quickly and efficiently, while maintaining board control with removal spells and disruptive creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben. The deck aims to apply pressure early in the game and keep opponents on the back foot with a mix of aggressive creatures and disruptive elements. With a focus on maintaining tempo and applying pressure, the deck seeks to overwhelm opponents before they can stabilize or mount a strong defense. Overall, the deck aims to win through a combination of combat damage and efficient removal spells.

The deck focuses on controlling the game and disrupting opponents through a combination of counter spells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers. Atraxa, Grand Unifier, serves as the commander, providing additional value and flexibility in managing threats. The deck includes a variety of efficient removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Fatal Push, as well as potent counterspells such as Cryptic Command and Force of Will. Powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Jace, the Mind Sculptor offer card advantage and board control. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure consistency and support the deck's high-powered spells. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue opponents and control the game until it can secure a win condition.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage provided by Ertai Resurrected as the commander. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan by countering key spells, removing threats from the board, and generating card advantage through card draw and recursion. With a variety of counterspells like Counterspell, Cryptic Command, and Force of Will, along with removal spells like Fatal Push, Damnation, and Toxic Deluge, the deck is well-equipped to handle a variety of threats. Ertai Resurrected's ability to sacrifice creatures to counter spells adds another layer of control to the deck, allowing the player to dictate the pace of the game and eventually emerge victorious.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of disruption, removal, and card advantage. Glarb, Calamity's Augur is the commander, providing a potent threat on its own while also generating card advantage. The deck includes a variety of counterspells like Force of Will and Cryptic Command to deal with threats, along with removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Baleful Mastery. Card advantage is gained through cards like Brainstorm, Gitaxian Probe, and Snapcaster Mage. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while gradually building its own resources and ultimately winning through incremental advantage and out-valuing the opponent. It also has a toolbox of spells to handle various situations, making it a flexible and adaptive control deck.

This deck focuses on fast-paced aggression and combo potential using the partner commanders Rograkh and Silas Renn. The deck includes a variety of spells to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy, such as counterspells like Force of Will and disruption spells like Duress and Thoughtseize. It also includes reanimation spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead to bring back key creatures from the graveyard. With cards like Dark Ritual and Cabal Ritual, the deck can generate mana quickly to cast powerful spells like Tendrils of Agony for a finishing blow. Overall, the deck aims to build a strong board presence while disrupting the opponent's game plan and setting up for a lethal combo finish.

This deck is centered around aggressive, fast-paced gameplay with a focus on dealing direct damage to the opponent. It includes a variety of low-cost creatures and burn spells to quickly chip away at the opponent's life total. The commander, Norin, Swift Survivalist, synergizes well with the strategy of constantly attacking and dealing damage. Cards like Lightning Bolt, Goblin Guide, and Monastery Swiftspear provide efficient ways to deal damage early on, while spells like Fireblast and Sulfuric Vortex offer additional reach to finish off the opponent. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a barrage of spells and creatures, maintaining pressure throughout the game until victory is achieved.

This deck focuses on using the synergy between Slimefoot and Squee to create a fast and aggressive playstyle. The deck includes a mix of ramp, removal, and recursion to support this strategy. By utilizing cards like Animate Dead, Goblin Bombardment, and Birthing Pod, the deck can quickly build a board presence and apply pressure on the opponent. Additionally, cards like Grist, the Hunger Tide and Yawgmoth, Thran Physician provide additional value by sacrificing creatures for various effects. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures, direct damage, and recursive threats, making it difficult for the opponent to keep up with the constant barrage of threats.
